content.stem:
A ball is thrown in the air. The height of the ball in terms of time is modeled by the graph shown.

 

A second ball is thrown from a lower initial height and reaches a higher maximum height.

 

  • Select an equation that represents the height of the second ball in terms of time.

     

  • Use the Add Point tool to plot two points on the grid:  the initial height of the second ball and its maximum height.

rubric.name: Rubric
rubric.val:
Exemplar:

 

  • (0,3) and (2.5, 9.25)

 

Other Correct Responses:

 

  •  

For this item, a full-credit response includes

 

  • selection of the correct equation (1 point)

        AND

  • correct placement of the points on the grid (1 point).

readAloud.textToSpeechPronunciation:
height. This is an interactive image. From left to right, The blue buttons above the image reed: Delete. Add point. The image is divided into two sections. The left section contains a graph. The x-axis is titled: Time, Seconds, and has a range from 0 to 5 increasing in increments of point 5. The why-axis is titled: Height, Meters, and has a range from 0 to 10 point 5 increasing in increments of point 7 5.
The right section reeds: from top to bottom:
Why equals negative x squared plus 2 x plus 3. Why equals x squared minus 3 x plus 4. Why equals negative x squared plus 4 x plus 6. Why equals negative x squared plus 5 x plus 3. Why equals x squared minus 4 x plus 2. Why equals negative x squared plus 5 x plus 5.

readAloud.audioShortDesc: y is equal to minus x raised to the power of 2 plus 5x plus 3

brailleText.brailleTextString: y is equal to minus x raised to the power of 2 plus 5x plus 3

content.stem:
Se lanza una pelota al aire. La gráfica de abajo muestra la altura de la pelota en función del tiempo.

 

Se lanza una segunda pelota desde una altura inicial menor y alcanza una altura máxima mayor.

 

Selecciona una ecuación que represente la altura de la segunda pelota en función del tiempo.

 

Usa la herramienta Agregar punto para graficar dos puntos sobre la cuadrícula: la altura inicial de la segunda pelota y su altura máxima.

 

A ball is thrown in the air. The height of the ball in terms of time is modeled by the graph shown.

 

A second ball is thrown from a lower initial height and reaches a higher maximum height.

 

  • Select an equation that represents the height of the second ball in terms of time.

     

  • Use the Add Point tool to plot two points on the grid:  the initial height of the second ball and its maximum height.

        AND

  • correct placement of the points on the grid (1 point).
